title: NCSU Dismisses Thornton After Arrest For Moped Accident
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest NCSU Dismisses Thornton After Arrest For Moped Accident North Carolina State has dismissed running back Shadrach Thornton from the team after another round of legal troubles. Post to Facebook NCSU Dismisses Thornton After Arrest For Moped Accident North Carolina State has dismissed running back Shadrach Thornton from the team after another round of legal troubles.  //on.wfmy.com/1FFPJRZ   Join the Conversation To   NCSU Dismisses Thornton After Arrest For Moped Accident AP/WFMY News 2 6:35 p.m. EDT September 30, 2015 North Carolina State Wolfpack running back Shadrach Thornton (10) runs the ball against the Old Dominion Monarchs at Foreman Field. (Photo: Peter Casey-USA TODAY Sports) 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
RALEIGH, N.C. -- North Carolina State has dismissed running back Shadrach Thornton from the team after another round of legal troubles. Coach Dave Doeren announced the decision in a statement Wednesday afternoon. That came less than a day after Raleigh police arrested Thornton following an accident in which he struck a pedestrian while riding a moped on a sidewalk and then left the scene. 
An accident report states the pedestrian needed stitches for a facial injury. 
Thornton, last year's leading rusher, had recently returned from a two-game suspension for a violation of athletic department policy. It was the senior's third suspension, the first two coming after brushes with the law in 2013. 
Doeren said it was "an unfortunate set of circumstances." The school says Thornton is on track to graduate in the spring. Read or Share this story: http://on.wfmy.com/1FFPJRZ TOP VIDEOS
